result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ

defendant.name: CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ, LEONARDO J
defendant.address: W1776 Aspen Ave, Pine River, WI 54965

records.addlTxt:
11:54 AM Defendant LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ in court.  Attorney Nadeska E Nino-Gomez in court for LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Enrique Soria in court. Interpreter was previously sworn in. State has two witnesses.

Connor Hunter sworn, direct by ADA McElroy. Is employed at the Green Lake County Sheriff's Office. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Cross by Atty Nino-Gomez. No redirect. Second witness called. Alex Midthun sworn, direct by ADA McElroy. Is employed as a Sheriff's Deputy for Waushara County. Testimony given. Identified defendant - present in court. Statement by the Court. Testimony continued. Cross by Atty Nino-Gomez.  Redirect by ADA McElroy. No recross by Atty Nino-Gomez. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court and confirms it mirrors the complaint with copy to Attorney Nino-Gomez. Attorney Nino-Gomez and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nino-Gomez enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 12:11 PM

Court will set for Status Hearing December 20, 2022 at 11:00 AM.
Status hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nadeska E Nino-Gomez in court for LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ.  Interpreter Enrique Soria in court. Atty Nin-Gomez requests a prelim be scheduled. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:30 Am
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 010260,
Payable Number: 68982,
Receipt Number: 22R 002994,
Amount: $20.00

10:35 AM Defendant LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ in court.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Enrique Soria in court - previously sworn. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes cash bond has been posted - and, if he does not have enough money, will allow the attorney to motion the court for some of the bond money to be used for a retainer fee. Statement by DA  Laspisa. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on July 26, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:41 AM
Second appearance scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Second appearance on July 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Warrant has been canceled - talked with Dave at GLSO.
Warrant has been canceled - talked with Dave at GLSO.

2:44 p.m.  ADA Matthew McElroy appears in court.  Defendant, Leonard Cruz-Benavidez appears by Zoom video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Enrique Soria, interpreter, appears by Zoom video.
Interpreter sworn by Clerk.  Court goes over file.  Court questions ADA McElroy.  Court questions defendant.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash.  Initial appearance is set for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Court adjourned 2:50 p.m.
Initial appearance on May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant's friend called stating the defendant received some mail from the department of transportation on some citations. Informed him that we have a warrant and he wanted to set a court date to appear. Defendant's address and phone number are correct. Defendant to appear on May 24, 2022 at 11:00 AM. He was also advised that the warrant would remain until he appeared in court.

9:23 AM Defendant LEONARDO J CRUZ-BENAVIDEZ not in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not in court or on zoom. Court orders a warrant - forthwith.

Court adjourned at 9:25 AM.
